Key Arguments: The Bill would end free speech in Australia and could apply overseas.
The Bill effectively creates a 'Ministry of Truth', similar to the one in George Orwell's book 1984.
There is no single source of truth, and different parties, experts, and individuals may have different facts.
Fact-checking is viewed as censorship and an attempt to control information.
The Bill exempts government and broadcasters from misinformation and disinformation rules, which is likened to practices in totalitarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: This Bill would end free speech in Australia.
It creates a ‘Ministry of Truth’, a la the George Orwell book 1984.
There is no ‘single source of truth’.
The Bill will create censorship befitting North Korea, not Australia.
